text: Samsung has made another fantastic
glorious beautiful looking phone called
the Galaxy s8 and I'm probably not going
to buy it one of the reasons that I just
will not make the switch over to a
Samsung phone or like the Galaxy s8
which is absolutely gorgeous
is because of the bloatware the extra
stuff that's added on there for no real
apparent reason we have Google Apps we
have Samsung Apps and we have T mobile
apps I mean for example we have the
Samsung Gmail app see here but we also
have Google's Gmail app here we have a
gallery app here and Google's Google
Photos app there it's just you know why
have two different apps that do the same
thing from different companies I don't
get it I really don't get it and now
actually we also have Samsung's Bixby
voice assistance which why I don't know
why it's there there's Google assistant
already on Android phones now I'm
speechless but it's there if you want it
so the apps thing is not the biggest
deal it's fine but the key thing that
really just stops me from like making
the leap over to the galaxy s 8 is the
fact that for one reason or the other
Samsung phones will get the latest
Android updates months after Google
releases this is insane to me but at the
same time you know I'm just one of those
people who really like to have the
latest and greatest updates have to do
with security has to do features it's
just one of those things I just want my
phone to be up to date when it is
available to go up today whereas on the
iPhone I get updates directly from Apple
the days released there's no problem
there so don't get me wrong the Galaxy
s8 is a phenomenal phone it is very fast
and beautiful but basically the main
reason why is why switch to something
more difficult when I have something so
easy to use already in my iPhone
[Music]
